newsitem.title: USA: Man shoots U.S. agents at Mexico border, is killed.
newsitem.headline: Man shoots U.S. agents at Mexico border, is killed.

text.p: Two U.S. Customs agents were shot and wounded at the U.S.-Mexico border on Thursday by a gunman who was then shot and killed by one of the injured inspectors, police said.
The shootout erupted during a Customs inspection near the border crossing at Calexico, some 120 miles (200 km) east of San Diego. Calexico is on the U.S. side of the border across from Mexicali.
"The subject (gunman) produced a gun and fired it, wounding two U.S. Customs inspectors," Calexico police Cmdr. Mario Sanchez said in a statement.
"Fire was returned; the subject was struck and died at the scene." The police statement said the wounded inspectors were in "stable condition."
It said the shooting took place "in the context of a U.S. Customs inspection," but it did not identify the assailant or say why he shot the U.S. officials.
